verses.verse: Remember <S%H2142><s%> <S%H8798><s%> now thy Creator <S%H1254><s%> <S%H8802><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of thy youth <S%H979><s%>, while the evil <S%H7451><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not, nor the years <S%H8141><s%> draw nigh <S%H5060><s%> <S%H8689><s%>, when thou shalt say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, I have no pleasure <S%H2656><s%> in them;

While the sun <S%H8121><s%>, or the light <S%H216><s%>, or the moon <S%H3394><s%>, or the stars <S%H3556><s%>, be not darkened <S%H2821><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, nor the clouds <S%H5645><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8804><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the rain <S%H1653><s%>:

In the day <S%H3117><s%> when the keepers <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8802><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> shall tremble <S%H2111><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and the strong <S%H2428><s%> men <S%H582><s%> shall bow <S%H5791><s%> <S%H8694><s%> themselves, and the grinders <S%H2912><s%> <S%H8802><s%> cease <S%H988><s%> <S%H8804><s%> because they are few <S%H4591><s%> <S%H8765><s%>, and those that look out <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8802><s%> of the windows <S%H699><s%> be darkened <S%H2821><s%> <S%H8804><s%>,

And the doors <S%H1817><s%> shall be shut <S%H5462><s%> <S%H8795><s%> in the streets <S%H7784><s%>, when the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the grinding <S%H2913><s%> is low <S%H8217><s%>, and he shall rise up <S%H6965><s%> <S%H8799><s%> at the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the bird <S%H6833><s%>, and all the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of musick <S%H7892><s%> shall be brought low <S%H7817><s%> <S%H8735><s%>;

Also when they shall be afraid <S%H3372><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of that which is high <S%H1364><s%>, and fears <S%H2849><s%> shall be in the way <S%H1870><s%>, and the almond tree <S%H8247><s%> shall flourish <S%H5006><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, and the grasshopper <S%H2284><s%> shall be a burden <S%H5445><s%> <S%H8691><s%>, and desire <S%H35><s%> shall fail <S%H6565><s%> <S%H8686><s%>: because man <S%H120><s%> goeth <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8802><s%> to his long <S%H5769><s%> home <S%H1004><s%>, and the mourners <S%H5594><s%> <S%H8802><s%> go about <S%H5437><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the streets <S%H7784><s%>:

Or ever <S%H3808><s%> the silver <S%H3701><s%> cord <S%H2256><s%> be loosed <S%H7576><s%> <S%H8735><s%> <S%H8675><s%> <S%H7368><s%> <S%H8735><s%>, or the golden <S%H2091><s%> bowl <S%H1543><s%> be broken <S%H7533><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, or the pitcher <S%H3537><s%> be broken <S%H7665><s%> <S%H8735><s%> at the fountain <S%H4002><s%>, or the wheel <S%H1534><s%> broken <S%H7533><s%> <S%H8738><s%> at the cistern <S%H953><s%>.

Then shall the dust <S%H6083><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to the earth <S%H776><s%> as it was: and the spirit <S%H7307><s%> shall return <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> who gave <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8804><s%> it.
Vanity <S%H1892><s%> of vanities <S%H1892><s%>, saith <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the preacher <S%H6953><s%>; all is vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

And moreover <S%H3148><s%>, because the preacher <S%H6953><s%> was wise <S%H2450><s%>, he still taught <S%H3925><s%> <S%H8765><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>; yea, he gave good heed <S%H239><s%> <S%H8765><s%>, and sought out <S%H2713><s%> <S%H8765><s%>, and set in order <S%H8626><s%> <S%H8765><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8687><s%> proverbs <S%H4912><s%>.

The preacher <S%H6953><s%> sought <S%H1245><s%> <S%H8765><s%> to find out <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8800><s%> acceptable <S%H2656><s%> words <S%H1697><s%>: and that which was written <S%H3789><s%> <S%H8803><s%> was upright <S%H3476><s%>, even words <S%H1697><s%> of truth <S%H571><s%>.

The words <S%H1697><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> are as goads <S%H1861><s%>, and as nails <S%H4930><s%> fastened <S%H5193><s%> <S%H8803><s%> by the masters <S%H1167><s%> of assemblies <S%H627><s%>, which are given <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8738><s%> from one <S%H259><s%> shepherd <S%H7462><s%> <S%H8802><s%>.

And further <S%H3148><s%>, by these <S%H1992><s%>, my son <S%H1121><s%>, be admonished <S%H2094><s%> <S%H8734><s%>: of making <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8800><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8687><s%> books <S%H5612><s%> there is no end <S%H7093><s%>; and much <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8687><s%> study <S%H3854><s%> is a weariness <S%H3024><s%> of the flesh <S%H1320><s%>.

Let us hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the conclusion <S%H5490><s%> of the whole matter <S%H1697><s%>: Fear <S%H3372><s%> <S%H8798><s%> 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>, and keep <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8798><s%> his Mitzvot <S%H4687><s%>: for this is the whole duty of man <S%H120><s%>.

For 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> shall bring <S%H935><s%> <S%H8686><s%> every work <S%H4639><s%> into judgment <S%H4941><s%>, with every secret thing <S%H5956><s%> <S%H8737><s%>, whether it be good <S%H2896><s%>, or whether it be evil <S%H7451><s%>.
